info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 24 at 10:52PM CDT until July 25 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from slow moving thunderstorms.
* WHERE...A portion of South Central Kansas, including the following county, Butler.
* WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT Friday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to numerous slow moving thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Dorado, Andover, Augusta, Rose Hill, Douglass, Towanda, Benton, Leon, Potwin, Rosalia, Cassoday, El Dorado Airport, El Dorado State Park, El Dorado Lake, Santa Fe Lake, Augusta Municipal Airport and Beaumont.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT FRIDAY
